repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
This decouples the playground window from query buffers, which should not be treated the same (i.e. we do not want to run the query linter in the playground window). We also use the indentation settings for the 'playground' filetype to determine the indentation level in the :InspectTree window.

This obviously conflicts with https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/22848, but should be an easy merge conflict to resolve.

comment_data.body:
I renamed `vim.treesitter.playground` to `vim.treesitter.dev` in https://github.com/neovim/neovim/commit/c48b1421af28d0317c807bca00c7e2fff97d9ad0 to avoid new jargon. "dev mode" or "dev tools" is already used and is more generic, so we don't need "playground".

For filetypes I think we need a `ts.` or `treesitter.` prefix. Using unqualified names like "query" and "playground" lacks context and risks conflict with other filetypes.
```suggestion
  vim.bo[b].filetype = 'treesitter.inspector'
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -542,7 +542,7 @@ function M.inspect_tree(opts)
   vim.bo[b].buflisted = false
   vim.bo[b].buftype = 'nofile'
   vim.bo[b].bufhidden = 'wipe'
-  vim.bo[b].filetype = 'query'
+  vim.bo[b].filetype = 'playground'

comment_data.body: `query` _is_ the filetype, though, in the standard Vim sense, required for syntax highlighting. (I'm not fully convinced we need a separate filetype to solve the actual issue, which is avoiding attaching the query linter to the tree view.)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -542,7 +542,7 @@ function M.inspect_tree(opts)
   vim.bo[b].buflisted = false
   vim.bo[b].buftype = 'nofile'
   vim.bo[b].bufhidden = 'wipe'
-  vim.bo[b].filetype = 'query'
+  vim.bo[b].filetype = 'playground'

comment_regular_data.body: Should we make it its own filetype, so you can configure these things with a `ftplugin`?

It already uses the `query` filetype, so we could just pick up the indentation from there.

We may want to change the default `'shiftwidth'` in the `query` ftplugin if we go that route though.

No, I mean using a _different_ filetype, so we can avoid triggering autocommands (like the linter) on the tree.

Increasing `sw` for query files makes sense to me, but then I don't lithp.

>No, I mean using a different filetype, so we can avoid triggering autocommands (like the linter) on the tree.

No objection here.

> (could use subtypes, like `query.tree`?)

I was thinking `playground` (since it sounds like we settled on that terminology in https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/22848).

Wouldn't `query.tree` still activate the `query` ftplugin?

> I was thinking playground (since it sounds like we settled on that terminology in https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/22848).

We'll hopefully add a query editor as well, which would probably a better use of that name?

> Wouldn't `query.tree` still activate the query ftplugin?

To be honest, I don't know; in that case that won't help, of course.

>We'll hopefully add a query editor as well, which would probably a better use of that name?

Why would the query editor not use the `query` filetype? Maybe I don't understand what the query editor is, but inferring from the name it sounds like a buffer where one... edits a query, so using the `query` filetype seems natural.
Regardless of *which* filetype to use, I think that is a good idea @clason. I've implemented it with `playground` for now but it's easy to change to something else when we can reach a consensus.

That is true; just going by the name "playground". For me, the tree is _not_ "the" playground; it's just part of it, just like the query editor.

Maybe `filetype` is not the right approach here, and we should use buffer title or `buftype` or somesuch. (And just increase the `sw` in the `query` ftplugin.)
(And if we do change the filetype, we need to register it for the `query` parser or @lewis6991 will be sad.)

title: fix(playground):  use 'playground' filetype for InspectTree
